context_of_use: This use case allows admins to manage product-related tasks within the system to ensure product availability and pricing accuracy.
stakeholders_and_interests: admin: Ensure product availability, maintain accurate pricing, and manage inventory effectively.
description: Allows admins to create products, update prices, and manage inventory levels to meet customer needs.
preconditions: Admin is logged into the system.
postconditions: Products are created, prices are updated, and inventory levels are managed successfully.
assumptions: Admin has the necessary permissions to manage products.
requirements_met: The system shall allow admins to create new products.
The system shall allow admins to update product prices.
The system shall allow admins to manage inventory levels.
main_flow: 1. Admin creates a new product → System saves the product and confirms creation with a success message.
2. Admin updates product prices → System updates the prices and confirms the changes with a success message.
3. Admin manages inventory levels → System updates inventory and confirms the changes with a success message.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If the product already exists, the system prompts the admin to update the existing product instead of creating a new one.
AF-2 (from Step 2): If the price update fails due to invalid data, the system displays an error message and allows the admin to correct the input.
AF-3 (from Step 3): If the inventory update is unsuccessful, the system notifies the admin and provides options to retry or cancel the operation.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If the admin is not authorized to create products, the system denies the action and displays an authorization error.
EF-2 (from Step 2): If the system encounters a database error while updating prices, it logs the error and notifies the admin of the failure.
EF-3 (from Step 3): If the inventory management operation times out, the system retries the operation once and notifies the admin of the outcome.
